column4: AstraZeneca widens cancer immunotherapy net with Advaxis trial

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Canadian National  energy shares spur TSX to record high
column5: (Adds comment from portfolio manager  details on market activity  updates prices)     By Alastair Sharp     TORONTO  July 22 Canadian National Railway and energy shares pushed Canada's main stock index higher on Tuesday  topping the record high it hit last week  as tensions eased in Ukraine.     CN Rail was the index's biggest positive force  up 1.6 percent at C$74.14  after the country's biggest railway reported record volumes and lifted forecasts after the bell on Monday.       Amo

column4: China food scandal spreads  drags in Starbucks  Burger King and McNuggets in Japan
